thread.title: National's 'Dunne' it again blocking El Alamein motion
thread.title_full: National's 'Dunne' it again blocking El Alamein motion

author: Fuseworks Media
title: National's 'Dunne' it again blocking El Alamein motion
text:
Fuseworks Media Thursday, 22 October, 2015 - 17:24 
The National Party and United Future leader Peter Dunne have refused to grant permission for a brief motion in Parliament marking the 73rd anniversary of World War Two Battle of El Alamein. 
"Centenarian North African veteran, Jack Martin, from Pahiatua, may have received a letter from the Prime Minister, but the National Party won’t grant one minute of parliamentary time to honour the sacrifice of his cobbers," says New Zealand First Palmerston North List MP Darroch Ball. 
"National has blocked motions on the Battle of Britain and now El Alamein - a battle that was the ‘end of the beginning’ for Nazi Germany. 
"As a former soldier I believe this proves the National Party does not care about serving soldiers, veterans or those who fell in service for their country. National pays lip service when we all ought to be paying real service. 
"There are few World War Two veterans alive with most in their 90’s or, like Mr Martin, now 100. Every anniversary date matters because it is our chance to show those still with us, and the families of those who are not, that we care," says Mr Ball. 
Darroch Ball’s motion without notice and without debate refused by the National Party and Peter Dunne: 
I move, on the eve of the 73rd Anniversary of the Battle of El Alamein, that this House honours surviving veterans, the memory of those who paid the ultimate sacrifice for freedom and those veterans who survived the war, but who are no longer with us.
